morsecode

Class MorseEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • morsecode.MorseEncoder

  • public class MorseEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the ability to encode character data and files into their equivalent representation in Morse Code. The International Morse Code alphabet is used, and only the letters A-Z are supported. For more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morse_code
    Author:
    __________________

    • Constructor Detail

      • MorseEncoder

        public MorseEncoder(java.lang.String characterMapFile)
             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Initializes a MorseEncoder object based on a character map file. The character map file is a CSV where each row represents the mapping between a single English alphabet character and the Morse Code equivalent. For example, rows in the should look like this: A,.- B,-... C,-.-. Further, MorseEncoder class assumes that rows in this file are in order from A-Z and that no additional data is present in the file. All exceptions arising during attempts to read character map file will be passed back to the client code.
        Parameters:
        characterMapFile - The name of the file containing Morse code character mappings.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the characterMapFile path is invalid

    • Method Detail

      • encodeChar

        public java.lang.String encodeChar(char plainChar)
        Encodes a single English alphabet character into Morse code based on the character map file specified at the time this MorseCode object was created. Lowercase and uppercase characters are treated equivalent in the conversion to Morse code.
        Parameters:
        plainChar - The alphabetic character to convert into Morse code.
        Returns:
        A string containing the corresponding Morse code character.
        Throws:
        morsecode.InvalidCharacterException - when a character other than A-Z or a-z is passed as plainChar.

      • encodeWord

        public java.lang.String encodeWord(java.lang.String plainWord)
        Encodes a whole English word into Morse code based on the character map file specified at the time this MorseCode object was created. Lowercase and uppercase characters are treated equivalent in the conversion to Morse code. Consecutive characters in the Morse code equivalent string will be separated by a single space character. For example: "DOG" ==> "-.. --- --."
        Parameters:
        plainWord - The word to convert into Morse code.
        Returns:
        A string containing the corresponding Morse code characters.
        Throws:
        morsecode.InvalidCharacterException - when plainWord contains one or more non-alphabetic characters.

      • encodeFile

        public void encodeFile(java.lang.String inputFile,
                       java.lang.String outputFile)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Processes a text input file and outputs its Morse code equivalent in a separate file. Line breaks are preserved between the input and output files in identical locations. Consecutive words on a single line will be rendered in the output file with the sequence " | " so that they can be easily distinguished in Morse code. Thus, if the input file contains the phrase: GO SPOT GO The output file will contain: --. --- | ... .--. --- - | --. --- Any exceptions that occur during file read/write will be passed back to the calling code.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The filename of the English based file to be processed.
        outputFile - The filename where the output will be written. Output files are always written in "write" mode and any existing contents will be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the inputFile does not exist.
        morsecode.InvalidCharacterException - when one or more invalid characters are detected while processing the input file.
